messages.subject: Re: Fuchigashira
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Allan, I knew that the dragon F/K below the tiger set was a gimei of Goto but the tiger set I thought was Kiyo, something? Well, maybe I ll have my own
messages.messageBody:
Hi Allan, I knew that the dragon F/K below the tiger set was a gimei
of Goto but the tiger set I thought was Kiyo, something? Well, maybe
I'll have my own niche of Goto knock-offs. John



--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Alan Bale" <abale@...> wrote:
>
> Hi John,
> The tiger F-K bears a false signature of Goto Denjo the 4th master
of the Kihei Goto branch family.
>
> Alan

fittings seem

mei

Shoami and
> Mito Kinko. Major schools are not too bad but all those small
makers

Shoami?

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Fuchigashira
messages.msgSnippet: Hi John, The tiger F-K bears a false signature of Goto Denjo the 4th master of the Kihei Goto branch family. Alan ... From: excelsiorilluminati To:
messages.messageBody:
Hi John,
The tiger F-K bears a false signature of Goto Denjo the 4th master of the Kihei Goto branch family.

Alan

----- Original Message -----
From: excelsiorilluminati
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, December 12, 2006 1:57 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Fuchigashira


Hello All, I have a F/K I would like to know school and smith of,
please. These kanji are out of norm for me. Some of these fittings seem
to be late Edo generic stuff and not attributable except when the mei
indicates the maker. The minefield of tsuba is tough enough with
excellent copies of copies confusing research, like the Aizu Shoami and
Mito Kinko. Major schools are not too bad but all those small makers
are hard to peg. Is this where if not attributable it is pegged Shoami?
John

It is the tiger F/K http://www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_9.htm

Thanks, John





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Fuchigashira
messages.msgSnippet: Hello All, I have a F/K I would like to know school and smith of, please. These kanji are out of norm for me. Some of these fittings seem to be late Edo
messages.messageBody:
Hello All, I have a F/K I would like to know school and smith of,
please. These kanji are out of norm for me. Some of these fittings seem
to be late Edo generic stuff and not attributable except when the mei
indicates the maker. The minefield of tsuba is tough enough with
excellent copies of copies confusing research, like the Aizu Shoami and
Mito Kinko. Major schools are not too bad but all those small makers
are hard to peg. Is this where if not attributable it is pegged Shoami?
John

It is the tiger F/K http://www.johnstuart.biz/new_page_9.htm

Thanks, John
